page.title: 06Ivington Camp,Iron Age Fort
page.content: In square No 1 of our area to the north west of Hope_under_Dinmore is an{Iron Age hill_fort}called{Ivington {Camp.}It stands{400 feet high}at the western end of a little ridge.It is {triangular}in shape and covers about {half a square mile.}The magnificently built banks and ditches are completely hidden by dense trees.About 35 years ago the present trees were planted to replace older ones then felled.This planting was done badly so that it is now impossible to see anything of the fort. Within the ramparts is a farm called{Camp Farm.}It is owned by Mr Stevens.The{northern}and{western sides of the camp are supposed to{follow Ley {Lines.}Mr Stevens showed us a{60 foot {deep well cut through solid rock.}This well has{never dried up.}Mr Stevens uses it for all his needs.Who dug the well and when is a complete mystery
